reading_passages.title: About North America
reading_passages.text: North America is the third-largest continent, extending from the Arctic Circle in the north to the tropics in the south. It encompasses diverse landscapes including mountains, plains, forests, deserts, and tundra. The continent is bordered by the Arctic Ocean to the north, the Atlantic Ocean to the east, the Pacific Ocean to the west, and South America and the Caribbean Sea to the south. North America's physical geography has significantly influenced human settlement patterns and economic development throughout history.

reading_passages.title: North American Geography
reading_passages.text: North America's geography features several major regions. The Canadian Shield is an ancient geological formation covering much of Canada. The Great Plains stretch from Canada to Mexico in the continent's interior. The Rocky Mountains form a spine along western North America, while the Appalachian Mountains run through the east. The continent contains significant water features including the Great Lakes, the Mississippi River system, and numerous other rivers and lakes. These diverse geographical features have shaped human settlement, agriculture, industry, and transportation networks across the continent.

scientific_phenomena.title: North America Climate
scientific_phenomena.description: North America spans multiple climate zones, from Arctic in the north to tropical in the south. The continent's climate is influenced by ocean currents, mountain ranges, and prevailing winds, creating diverse regional weather patterns and seasonal variations.
observation_prompts: What climate features can you identify in North America?
How might climate affect people living in different regions of North America?
What patterns do you notice about climate zones from north to south in North America?

scientific_phenomena.title: North America Ecosystems
scientific_phenomena.description: North America contains diverse ecosystems including tundra, boreal forests, temperate deciduous forests, grasslands, deserts, and tropical forests. These ecosystems support unique plant and animal communities adapted to specific environmental conditions.
observation_prompts: What ecosystem features can you identify in North America?
How might these ecosystems affect human settlement and activities?
What patterns do you notice about how ecosystems are distributed across North America?
